trans-unit.source: Implements the basic functionality required by Web controls that contain child controls.

The CompositeControl class is an abstract class that provides naming container and control designer functionality for custom controls that encompass child controls in their entirety or use the functionality of other controls.
This class is inherited by controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard>.
You cannot use this class directly.
The CompositeControl class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface.
This is required to ensure that all child control ID attributes are unique, and can be located on post back for data binding.
To create a custom composite control, derive from the CompositeControl class.

The functionality this class provides is built-in verification that child controls have been created prior to being accessed and it enables the design-time environment to recreate the collection of child controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl.Controls%2A> property ensures that all child controls have been created prior to accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl.DataBind%2A> method verifies that all child controls have been created prior to binding them to a data source.
Control developers can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> class to create a custom designer for a composite control derived from CompositeControl.
A control designer is a class that defines how a control is displayed and manipulated in design view.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl> constructor is called by ASP.NET to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl>.
This constructor is not intended to be used from your code.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object that represents the child controls in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref>.
The Controls property overrides the base implementation to ensure that all child controls have been created prior to returning the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> object.
The Controls property allows you to programmatically access the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl>.
You can add controls to, or remove controls from the collection, and iterate through the controls in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> that represents the child controls in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref>.
Binds a data source to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> and all its child controls.
The DataBind method binds a data source to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl> control and all its child controls.
This DataBind method overrides its base implementation to verify that all child controls have been created prior to binding them to a data source.
Recreates the child controls in a control derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref>.
The RecreateChildControls method is used primarily by control developers.
Writes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> content to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, for display on the client.
The Render method writes the rendered content of the control and its child controls to the client using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter>.

This method overrides the base implementation to ensure that all child controls in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl.Controls%2A> collection are created and then renders the control and its child controls using the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Render%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderChildren%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.

Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the <xref uid="langword_csharp_disabled" name="disabled" href=""></xref> attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled.
If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled.
If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than `4.0`; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Enables a designer to recreate the composite control's collection of child controls in the design-time environment.
